data.title: About
data.meta_description: Our Humble Beginnings In 1950, Russell D. Carter began a remarkable journey with just $300 and a vision, crafting Carter's first kitchen in his Roanoke home's basement. His tenacity led him to secure jobs by personally approaching homes under construction. By 1953, Carter borrowed $8,000 to build the first business location at 2132 Shenandoah Valley…
data.text:
We collaborate closely with general contractors, designers, architects, and material suppliers to deliver the highest quality and service.

Whether you prefer our recommendations or have your own design and architecture team in mind, we’re here to accommodate your preferences.

Thank you for considering Carter’s Cabinet Shop for your cabinet needs. We look forward to the opportunity to transform your space with our exceptional craftsmanship and unwavering commitment to quality.
